page.description:
All properties that are arrays support the following properties and methods. Since an array may support several types of objects, you must check an item for token type (using the TargetTokenType property) before referencing its properties. The list items may be accessed using array syntax.
All functions take a zero-based position index. Array syntax is one-based.

property.name: Count
property.description: Read. The number of elements in the list.

methodref.name: Add
methodref.description: Inserts an item at the end of the list. The item must be a valid type for the list.

methodref.name: InsertBefore
methodref.description: Inserts an item prior to the specified position. The item must be a valid type for the list.

methodref.name: Item
methodref.description: Returns the item at the specified index.

methodref.name: Remove
methodref.description: Removes the item at the specified position.
